metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: You have already learned from the previous chapters that you can create and call a function in the following way:
content.html: You have already learned from the previous chapters that you can create and call a function in the following way:

content.code_html:
// Create a function
void myFunction() {
  printf("I just got executed!");
}

int main() {
  myFunction(); // call the function
  return 0;
}

content.text: A function consist of two parts:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
void myFunction() { // declaration  // 
    the body of the function (definition)}

content.code:
void myFunction() { // declaration  //
the body of the function (definition)}

syntax_highlighting.text:
void myFunction() { // declaration  // 
    the body of the function (definition)}

content.code_html:
void myFunction() { // declaration
  // the body of the function (definition)
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
void myFunction() { // declaration  // 
    the body of the function (definition)}

content.text: For code optimization, it is recommended to separate the declaration and the definition of the function.
content.html: For code optimization, it is recommended to separate the declaration and the definition of the function.

content.text: You will often see C programs that have function declaration above main() , and function definition below main() .
content.html: You will often see C programs that have function declaration above main(), and function definition below main().

content.text: This will make the code better organized and easier to read:
content.html: This will make the code better organized and easier to read:

content.code_html:
// Function declaration
void myFunction();

// The main method
int main() {
  myFunction();  // call the function
  return 0;
}

// Function definition
void myFunction() {
  printf("I just got executed!");
}

content.text: If we use the example from the function parameters chapter regarding parameters and return values:
content.html: If we use the example from the function parameters chapter regarding parameters and return values:

content.code_html:
int myFunction(int x, int y) {
  return x + y;
}

int main() {
  int result = myFunction(5, 3);
  printf("Result is = %d", result);
  return 0;
}
// Outputs 8 (5 + 3)

content.text: It is considered good practice to write it like this instead:
content.html: It is considered good practice to write it like this instead:

content.code_html:
// Function declaration
int myFunction(int x, int y);

// The main method
int main() {
  int result = myFunction(5, 3); // call the function
  printf("Result is = %d", result);
  return 0;
}

// Function definition
int myFunction(int x, int y) {
  return x + y;
}

content.text: As long as you declare functions first, it is also possible to use functions to call other functions:
content.html: As long as you declare functions first, it is also possible to use functions to call other functions:

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Declare two functions, myFunction and myOtherFunction

syntax_highlighting.text: // Declare two functions, myFunction and myOtherFunction

content.code_html:
// Declare two functions, myFunction and myOtherFunction
void myFunction();
void myOtherFunction();

int main() {
  myFunction(); // call myFunction (from main)
  return 0;
}

// Define myFunction
void myFunction() {
  printf("Some text in myFunction\n");
  myOtherFunction(); // call myOtherFunction (from myFunction)
}

// Define myOtherFunction
void myOtherFunction() {
  printf("Hey! Some text in myOtherFunction\n");
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Declare two functions, myFunction and myOtherFunction

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a function declaration in C?
content.html: What is a function declaration in C?
